statement.tex: \\ \text{Which of the following would be the smarter}\\ \text{substitution to make?}
\\ \text{Is the following the correct integral }\\ \text{- in terms of x}?

reason.tex: \text{When substituting, try and pick a }t = f(x)\\ \text{so that something that looks like }dt = f'(x) \\ \text{is in the numerator and something with}\\ \text{just t = f(x) is in the denominator.}
\text{Use the standard result, }\\ \int\dfrac{dt}{a^2-t^2} = \dfrac{1}{2a}\log\left| \dfrac{a+t}{a-t}\right| + C.\\ \text{And here, }a = 1\text{ and } t = x^3.
